bioghist.p: Charles Lyon Chandler (1883-1962) was a United States foreign service officer, Philadelphia banker, history professor, and author.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of weekly reports made by Charles Lyon Chandler to the Board of the Corn Exchange Bank at the suggestion of Mr. Samuel F. Houston, 1932-1942. Reports discuss international economic and political conditions and include information on international bank deposits, foreign currency exchange, gold reserves, and figures on imports and exports.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of Charles Lyon Chandler, 1956
